page.title: 09GAMES PLAYED IN CURY SCHOOL
page.content: The children play a variety of games -far too many to describe in detail. They vary from simple chase games such as tag or tig to more complicated games involving more technique. There are skipping games either singly or several skipping at a time to a tune or rhythm. Ball games are popular with the use of tennis type balls for throwing and catching and larger balls for kicking or passing in football practice or throwing and catching as in netball practice. There is the use of bats and balls. Some play with very small glass balls called marbles. There are seasonal games such as conkers where the best conker(horsechestnut) is 'kingy'. There is 'hide & seek' where someone has to find the rest of the children. Some act out situations like 'cowboys & indians'.
